page.title: 18Shopping Habits.
page.content: As there are only a few shops in Ringstead,the children took home a questionaire to find out from where their parents bought the following items:-Bread,eggs,groceries,toys clothes,shoes,saucepans,furniture, televisions, cars,and gardening goods. The results of the survey are as follows:-Most people bought bread, eggs and some groceries in Ringstead but went to larger towns for most of their other needs.Kettering was the most popular shopping centre for every type of goods with Raunds and Rushden next.Clothes and furniture were bought mostly from Northampton with Wellingborough the next most popular. A few people shopped in Milton Keynes, Leicester,Corby and London.As there is no bus service to Thrapston very few people went there.
